definitions.definition: an area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture, typically bounded by hedges or fences.
a piece of land used for a particular purpose, especially an area marked out for a game or sport.
defensive play or the defensive positions collectively.
examples: he is fast in the field and on the bases

definitions.definition: a large area of land or water completely covered in a particular substance, especially snow or ice.
an area rich in a natural product, typically oil or gas.
an area on which a battle is fought.
a battle.
examples: many a bloody field was to be fought

definitions.definition: a place where a subject of scientific study or artistic representation can be observed in its natural location or context.
a particular branch of study or sphere of activity or interest.
examples: we talked to professionals in various fields

definitions.definition: a part of a record, representing an item of data.
a general area of meaning within which individual words make particular distinctions.
a space or range within which objects are visible from a particular viewpoint or through a piece of apparatus.
examples: the stars drift through this telescope's field of view

definitions.definition: an area on a flag with a single background color.
examples: fifty white stars on a blue field

definitions.definition: the surface of an escutcheon or of one of its divisions.
all the participants in a contest or sport.
examples: he destroyed the rest of the field with a devastating injection of speed
synonyms: possibles "she is well ahead of the field"

definitions.definition: the region in which a particular condition prevails, especially one in which a force or influence is effective regardless of the presence or absence of a material medium.
the force exerted or potentially exerted in a field.
examples: the variation in the strength of the field

definitions.definition: a system subject to two binary operations analogous to those for the multiplication and addition of real numbers, and having similar commutative and distributive laws.
play as a fielder.
catch or stop (the ball).
examples: he fielded the ball cleanly, but threw it down the right-field line

definitions.definition: send out (a team or individual) to play in a game.
examples: a high school that traditionally fielded mediocre teams

definitions.definition: (of a political party) nominate (a candidate) to run in an election.
examples: a radical political party that is beginning to field candidates in local elections

definitions.definition: deploy (an army).
examples: no one had the power to field an army of any consequence
synonyms: dispose "they can field an army of about one million"

definitions.definition: deal with (a difficult question, telephone call, etc.).
examples: she has fielded five calls from salespeople
synonyms: respond to "he fielded some awkward questions"
